text:
Suspended RJD MLA Raj Ballabh Yadav, who has been evading arrest in an alleged rape case, will surrender before the Nalanda court on Thursday, a party legislator said on Tuesday.

“Raj Ballabh will surrender before Nalanda civil court on February 18 in an alleged rape case in which he has been falsely implicated,” District RJD president Mahendra Yadav and Rajauli MLA Prakash Vir told reporters here at a press conference.

Mr. Vir said he received information from family members that Mr. Yadav would surrender in the court on Thursday as the police had been conducting raids at his residences.

Mr. Yadav was neither named in the FIR, nor in the statement made by the victim.

Mr. Yadav had full faith in the judiciary and he would surrender before the court to come clean, he claimed.

A local court on Monday issued arrest warrants against Mr. Yadav and three others in a rape case involving a minor. — PTI
title: Suspended RJD MLA to surrender in court tomorrow
